page.title: 02Housing:Nibley/Woodmancote
page.content: The houses in Nibley are scattered over a large area.There is a large variety of styles and ages from 18th century bow-windowed houses to new estates of council housing in the centre of the village.In Woodmancote there are approximately equal numbers of modern and three-storey 18th century houses.In both areas Cotswold Stone walls predominate in the older of the properties.When they were built the stone was cheap and in abundance. It now raises the value of the house.One house in Wodmancote has a wrought iron porch that is listed while the house itself,a fine early 18th century building,is not! Present house selling prices are :Â£17OOO for a small end terrace; Â£44OOO for a 193O's detached house; Â£6OOOO for a larger cottage with 4.5 acres of ground.
